    "target_object": "a sport car",
    "generation_metadata": "Detailed description of the object and the 16 views for 3D reconstruction, including specific angle descriptions, lighting specifications, material properties, and geometric constraints. MUST address the specific issues from previous feedback: Scoring penalties applied: Lighting issues: -1 point image quality; Angle/view issues: -1 point completeness; Background issues: -1 point image quality; Improvement suggestions found: -1 point each for scores >7; Quality issues: -2 points image quality. - Ensure consistent lighting across all images to avoid reflections and overexposure. - Remove any platforms or markings from the background to maintain a clean, neutral space. - Capture a wider variety of angles, ensuring all primary and oblique angles are distinct and cover the full 360-degree sphere. CRITICAL: Object details must remain identical across all views. Learning from 1 previous iterations.",
    "image_prompt": "A PERFECT 4x4 grid layout containing exactly sixteen individual digital photographs, arranged in 4 rows and 4 columns, featuring the EXACT SAME sport car captured from 16 DISTINCTLY DIFFERENT 3D angles. Each of the 16 sub-images must be clearly separated and show the IDENTICAL sport car from a UNIQUE 3D viewpoint covering the full 360-degree sphere around the object. The 16 angles must include: front, back, left, right, top, bottom, and 10 additional oblique angles distributed evenly around the 3D space (front-left, front-right, back-left, back-right, top-front, top-back, top-left, top-right, bottom-front, bottom-back, etc.). Each grid position must show a COMPLETELY DIFFERENT 3D angle - no two grids should have similar viewpoints. The object's appearance, details, and characteristics remain COMPLETELY IDENTICAL across all 16 views - only the 3D viewing angle changes. The sport car is centered in each view, with consistent lighting, scale, and positioning. CRITICAL: ONLY the sport car should be visible - NO other objects, items, accessories, or environmental elements. The background must be COMPLETELY PURE WHITE with NO shadows, textures, patterns, or any other elements. The sport car should appear to float in pure white space, suitable for 3D reconstruction. CRITICAL: This MUST be a perfect 4x4 grid with exactly 16 individual sub-images, not a single large image.",

The grid maintains consistent lighting and a pure white background to eliminate distractions and enhance image quality. image_prompt: A 4x4 grid of a sport car from different angles

evaluation_results.short_summary:
Image Quality: 4/10
- The images lack clarity and have inconsistent lighting.
evaluation_results.markdown_report:
Image Quality: 4/10
- The images lack clarity and have inconsistent lighting. The resolution is not high enough for detailed 3D reconstruction, and there are noticeable visual artifacts.

Metadata Accuracy: 3/10
- The images do not match the metadata requirements. There are multiple types of cars and objects present, which deviates from the target object specification.

Completeness: 2/10
- The 4x4 grid requirement is not met. There are not 16 distinct views of a single object. The images show different cars and parts, failing to provide comprehensive coverage of one sport car.

Suggestions for Improvement:
- Ensure all images are of the same sport car with consistent lighting and high resolution.
- Remove any additional objects and focus solely on the car.
- Improve clarity and focus to eliminate visual artifacts.

Metadata Suggestions:
- Specify a single sport car model in the metadata.
- Ensure the prompt includes a requirement for a clean, white background and consistent lighting.
- Clearly define the need for 16 distinct angles of the same car for accurate 3D reconstruction.

Extremely Critical Evaluation Points:
- The grid is not a perfect 4x4 with 16 distinct sub-images of the same object.
- Backgrounds are inconsistent and not purely white.
- Object consistency is lacking, with multiple car models and parts shown.
- Angle diversity is not achieved, as there are not 16 unique angles of a single car.
